sentences.sContent: Aspirin may discourage tumour growth in some types of cancer.
sentences.sCn: 阿司匹林可能遏制某些恶性肿瘤的生长。

sentences.sContent: ...The reasoning behind this saying is that low oil prices discourage investment in new production capacity...
...low fossil fuel prices could discourage further innovation in...
...The theory is that smoking should be stripped of any appeal to discourage new generations from starting in the first place...
...These should discourage retailers from wasteful practices that lead to the rejection of food on the basis of cosmetic characteristics...
...Societies that cannot replace their populations discourage investment and innovation...
...Child experts discourage a one-size-fits-all approach to parenting...

words.tran: 使人沮丧的；令人气馁的
使人气馁地，使人沮丧地；阻止地
劝阻（discourage的过去分词）；使失去勇气

trans.tranOther: to make something less likely to happen
